Description : TCP/IP SystemVerilog SHUNT SystemVerilog initiator/target handshake examle  -Initiator(server)

cs_common

Common macro and parameter definitions for the client-server implementation

Initiator
module automatic Initiator

TCP/IP SystemVerilog SHUNT Initiator module implementation

This module serves as the server in a client-server communication model.  It demonstrates the handshake protocol between SystemVerilog components.

The module initializes a socket connection and performs various data type loopback tests to verify the communication channel.

Variables
Socket
int Socket

Socket descriptor for TCP/IP communication

h_trnx_exp
cs_header_t h_trnx_exp

Expected transaction header for data validation

h_data_exp
cs_data_header_t h_data_exp

Expected data header for data validation

h_trnx_act
cs_header_t h_trnx_act

Actual transaction header received from the target

h_data_act
cs_data_header_t h_data_act

Actual data header received from the target

Pass
int Pass

Test pass/fail status flag

Status
string Status

Test status message

Test_name
string Test_name

Current test name for reporting

function int string_loopback_test(
int 
socket_id
)

Performs a loopback test for string data type

Parameters
socket_id
int

Socket identifier for the connection

Returns
success

1 if test passed, 0 if failed

Notes

Sends a predefined string to the target and verifies the returned string Uses the STRING_MESSAGE constant defined in the common include file

Notes

intV_loopback_test
function int intV_loopback_test(
int 
socket_id
)

Performs a loopback test for fixed-size int array data type

Parameters
socket_id
int

Socket identifier for the connection

Returns
success

1 if test passed, 0 if failed

Notes

Tests sending and receiving fixed-size int arrays (size defined by V_SIZE macro) Uses direct shunt_dpi_send_intV and shunt_dpi_recv_intV functions instead of handshake protocol

reg_loopback_test
function int reg_loopback_test(
int 
socket_id,
int 
n_payloads
 = 
1
)

Performs a loopback test for reg data type

Parameters
socket_id
int

Socket identifier for the connection

n_payloads
int

Width parameter, not used in traditional sense (default: 1)

Returns
success

1 if test passed, 0 if failed

Notes

Tests sending and receiving large register values (133 bits) Uses random values mixed with X states to verify 4-state logic handling

bit_loopback_test
function int bit_loopback_test(
int 
socket_id,
int 
n_payloads
 = 
1
)

Performs a loopback test for bit data type

Parameters
socket_id
int

Socket identifier for the connection

n_payloads
int

Width parameter, not used in traditional sense (default: 1)

Returns
success

1 if test passed, 0 if failed

Notes

Tests sending and receiving large bit vectors (133 bits) Uses only 2-state logic (0 and 1) without X or Z states

integer_loopback_test
function int integer_loopback_test(
int 
socket_id,
int 
n_payloads
 = 
1
)

Performs a loopback test for integer data type

Parameters
socket_id
int

Socket identifier for the connection

n_payloads
int

Number of integer elements to test (default: 1)

Returns
success

1 if test passed, 0 if failed

Notes

Tests sending and receiving integer arrays with random values including X states Uses strict 4-state equality comparison (!==) to verify exact matches

print_status
function void print_status(
string 
Test_name,
int 
Status_int
)

Utility function to display test results

Parameters
Test_name
string

Name of the test being reported

Status_int
int

Status flag (1 for PASS, 0 for FAIL)

Returns

void

Notes

Converts numeric status to human-readable PASS/FAIL string and displays it
